intro: Perilomia ocymoides var. glabrior, commonly known as the smooth perilomia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with a smooth, glabrous surface, giving the plant its varietal name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and attract a variety of pollinators.
